qas.question: What did the Prussian Army hold in Paris on 17 February?
Under what provision was the Prussian Army permitted to have a victory parade?
To hounour the armistice, Bismarck allowed train loads of what into Paris?
France had to consent to pay how much in war indemnity?
An ensuing mass exodus from Paris saw how many people head for the countryside?

context: The Prussian Army, under <a1_0>the terms of the armistice<a1_0/>, held <a0_0>a brief victory parade<a0_0/> in Paris on 17 February; the city was silent and draped with black and the Germans quickly withdrew. Bismarck honoured the armistice, by allowing train loads of <a2_0>food<a2_0/> into Paris and withdrawing Prussian forces to the east of the city, prior to a full withdrawal once France agreed to pay a <a3_0>five billion franc<a3_0/> war indemnity. At the same time, Prussian forces were concentrated in the provinces of Alsace and Lorraine. An exodus occurred from Paris as some <a4_0>200,000<a4_0/> people, predominantly middle-class, went to the countryside.
